title: Woman, 28, with blood-soaked hands gets arrested after two men were stabbed with a 'kitchen knife'
text:
A woman with blood-soaked hands has been arrested by Taser-wielding police officers after two men were allegedly stabbed with a kitchen knife.

She was pinned to the ground by officers after witnesses saw a man with blood pouring from his back at 4pm today in Longsight, Manchester.

Crowds gathered as police arrested the woman, 28, after a 17-year-old and 20-year-old were taken to hospital with stab wounds.

A 28-year-old woman with blood-soaked hands has been arrested after a 17-year-old boy and a 20-year-old man were allegedly stabbed with a kitchen knife

She was pinned to the ground by officers after witnesses saw a man with blood pouring from his back at 4pm today in Longsight, Manchester

One witness told the Manchester Evening News: 'She had a knife on her. She was trying to get into the Post Office.

'She stabbed a young boy in the lower back on the left hand side.

'She had a kitchen knife, it was six or seven inches. She was running at each boy.'

Their injuries are not believed to be life threatening, according to Greater Manchester Police.

The woman has been arrested on suspicion of wounding with intent and remains in custody for questioning.
description: A 28-year-old woman with blood-soaked hands has been arrested after a 17-year-old boy and a 20-year-old man were taken to hospital with stab wounds in Longsight, Manchester, today.
